abstract_summ: MATERIALS AND METHODS: This retrospective study included 20 pairs of CT scans and same-day chest radiographs from 17 patients with COVID-19, along with 20 chest radiographs of controls.This prospective study was carried out in the emergency department (ED), confirmed or clinically highly suspicious COVID-19 patients were recruited and were subjected to a chest CT and concurrent LUS exam.Abstract Objective The purpose of this study was to distinguish the imaging features of COVID-19 from those of other chest infectious diseases and evaluate the diagnostic value of chest CT for suspected COVID-19 patients.There was no significant difference in eight radiologist identified CT image features between the two groups of patients.Methods: Adult suspected patients aged >18 years within 14 days who underwent chest CT scan and reverse-transcription polymerase-chain-reaction (RT-PCR) tests were enrolled.
title_summ: Extension of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) on Chest CT and Implications for Chest Radiograph InterpretationHigh-resolution computed tomography finding in 552 patients with symptomatic COVID-19: first report from north of IranCORRELATION BETWEEN CHEST COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY AND LUNG ULTRASONOGRAPHY IN PATIENTS WITH CORONAVIRUS DISEASE 2019 (COVID-19)Chest CT Images for COVID-19: Radiologists and Computer-based detectionCORRELATION BETWEEN CHEST COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY AND LUNG ULTRASONOGRAPHY IN PATIENTS WITH CORONAVIRUS DISEASE 2019 (COVID-19)Early chest computed tomography to diagnose COVID-19 from suspected patients: A multicenter retrospective studyClinical and Imaging Findings in COVID-19 Patients Complicated by Pulmonary EmbolismEarly chest computed tomography to diagnose COVID-19 from suspected patients: A multicenter retrospective studyClinical and radiological characteristics of pediatric patients with COVID-19: focus on imaging findingsIncidental diagnosis of Covid-19 pneumonia on chest computed tomographyPerformance of radiologists in differentiating COVID-19 from viral pneumonia on chest CTCT differential diagnosis of COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 in symptomatic suspects: a practical scoring method
title_abstract_phrases: This prospective study was carried out in the emergency department (ED), confirmed or clinically highly suspicious COVID-19 patients were recruited and were subjected to a chest CT and concurrent LUS exam.Early chest computed tomography to diagnose COVID-19 from suspected patients: A multicenter retrospective studyAbstract Objective The purpose of this study was to distinguish the imaging features of COVID-19 from those of other chest infectious diseases and evaluate the diagnostic value of chest CT for suspected COVID-19 patients.MATERIALS AND METHODS: This retrospective study included 20 pairs of CT scans and same-day chest radiographs from 17 patients with COVID-19, along with 20 chest radiographs of controls.Methods: Adult suspected patients aged >18 years within 14 days who underwent chest CT scan and reverse-transcription polymerase-chain-reaction (RT-PCR) tests were enrolled.There was no significant difference in eight radiologist identified CT image features between the two groups of patients.
